    • Method Detail

      • generateAltitude

        public int generateAltitude()
        generateAltitude: Randomly assigns one of three different altitudes to a flight
        Returns:
        A random altitude (either 3000, 4000 or 0)

      • calculateHeadingToNextWaypoint

        public double calculateHeadingToNextWaypoint(double desX,
                                    double desY)
        calculateHeadingToFirstWaypoint: calculates heading between flight's current position and the first waypoint in the flight's plan. The flight's current position will always be its entrypoint because this method is only called within the newFlight() function in airspace.
        Parameters:
        desX - - The X coordinate of the waypoint
        dexY - - The Y coordinate of the waypoint
        Returns:
        The heading between the flight and first waypoint.

      • turnFlightLeft

        public void turnFlightLeft(int degreeTurnedBy)
        turnFlightLeft: sets the target heading to certain amount to to the left of the flight's current heading. When an angle is entered in the textfields found in Controls, the value is passed to turnFlightLeft. The turningLeft boolean is set in order to tell the updateCurrentHeading() method that the flight should turn left towards it's target heading.
        Parameters:
        degreeTurnedBy - - The amount of degrees you want to turn left by.

      • turnFlightRight

        public void turnFlightRight(int degreeTurnedBy)
        turnFlightRight: sets the target heading to certain amount to to the right of the flight's current heading. When an angle is entered in the textfields found in Controls, the value is passed to turnFlightRight. The turningRight boolean is set in order to tell the updateCurrentHeading() method that the flight should turn right towards it's target heading.
        Parameters:
        degreeTurnedBy - - The amount of degrees you want to turn right by.

      • giveHeading

        public void giveHeading(int newHeading)
        giveHeading: Changes the target heading to newHeading. Whenever a command is issued by the user to change the heading, the method is passed the value of that command. The heading is always adjusted to a value between 0 and 359. This is done using newHeading % 360.
        Parameters:
        newHeading - - The heading the flight has been commmanded to fly at.

      • incrementHeading

        public void incrementHeading()
        Increments the heading by 1 and resets it to 0 if it's over 360

      • decrementHeading

        public void decrementHeading()
        Decrements heading by 1 and resets it to 360 if it's under 0

      • checkIfFlightAtWaypoint

        public boolean checkIfFlightAtWaypoint(Point waypoint)
        checkIfFlightAtWaypoint: checks whether a flight is close enough to the next waypoint in it's plan for it to be considered at that waypoint. Update the closestDistance so that it knows how close the plane was from the waypoint when it leaves the waypoint. This is so the score can be updated correctly
        Parameters:
        Waypoint - - The next waypoint in the flight's plan.
        Returns:
        True if flight is at it's next waypoint and it is moving away from that waypoint.

      • minDistanceFromWaypoint

        public int minDistanceFromWaypoint(Point waypoint)
        Distnace from waypoint to be considered visisted
        Parameters:
        waypoint -
        Returns:

      • resetMinDistanceFromWaypoint

        public void resetMinDistanceFromWaypoint()
        Resets the value back to maximum

        public void takeOff()
        Take off the plane

      • altToLand

        public boolean altToLand()
        Whether the altitude is right to land
        Returns:

      • land

        public void land()
        Method for landing hte plane

      • steerLandingFlight

        public void steerLandingFlight()
        Get the landing flight to face the last exitpoint (end of runway waypoint)

      • findLandingDescentRate

        public double findLandingDescentRate()
        Calculates the rate at which a plane has to descend, given its current altitude, such that by the time it reaches the runway, its altitude is 0
        Returns:
        Rate at which plane needs to descend

      • drawFlight

        public void drawFlight(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
              org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc)
        drawFlight: draws the flight at it's current x,y and draws its information around within a circle. Different images for the flight are used depending on how fast the plane is.
        Parameters:
        g - - Graphics libraries required by slick2d.
        gc - - GameContainer required by slick2d.

      • updateXYCoordinates

        public void updateXYCoordinates()
        updateXYCoordinates: updates the x and y values of the plane depending on it's velocity and it's current heading. The velocity of the plane is scaled so that it can be used for movement in terms of pixels.

      • updateAltitude

        public void updateAltitude()
        updateAltitude(): If the target altitude is higher than the current altitude, increase current altitude. If target altitude is less than current altitude, decrease current altitude. If current altitude and target altitude are the same, do nothing.

      • updateCurrentHeading

        public void updateCurrentHeading()
        updateCurrentHeading(): Moves the current heading towards the target heading. If a user has issued a heading but not specified what way to turn, this method will determine what way it would be quicker to turn towards it's target heading.

      • updateVelocity

        public void updateVelocity()
        Method to change the velocity of the planes

      • init

        public void init(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc)
          throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        init: initialises resources such as images.
        Parameters:
        gc - - GameContainer required by slick2d.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

        public void update(ScoreTracking score)
        Update: calls all the update functions.

        Tests whether a plane is within the right tolerance to land properly
        Parameters:

        x2 -
